meanings.definition: The act of seeking favor by flattery or servile behavior.
meanings.sent1: Her constant sycophancies towards the boss were obvious to everyone in the office.
meanings.sent2: The politician was surrounded by sycophancies who praised his every move.
meanings.sent3: The sycophancies of the new employee were so over-the-top that they made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The sycophancies of the salesperson were like a never-ending stream of insincere compliments.
meanings.sent5: The sycophancies of the student were like a bright neon sign, impossible to ignore.

meanings.definition: Flattering or servile behavior towards someone important.
meanings.sent1: His sycophancies towards the celebrity were so extreme that they made others uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The courtiers' sycophancies towards the king knew no bounds.
meanings.sent3: The sycophancies of the waiter towards the customer were so exaggerated that they seemed comical.
meanings.sent4: Her sycophancies towards her wealthy relatives were like a mask she put on to gain their favor.
meanings.sent5: The sycophancies of the assistant were like a constant background noise, always present but never truly acknowledged.
